intro: Cola gilletii, commonly known as African cola, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of bright red berries. The plant produces a stimulant-rich seed, which is used in traditional medicine and as a flavoring agent. Cola gilletii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both ecological and economic contexts.
